caption: A heartfelt country ballad with warm acoustic guitar fingerpicking, pedal steel guitar, and sincere male vocals. The production features gentle fiddle accents, soft brushed drums, and rich harmonies that evoke wide open spaces and honest emotion.
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
Driving down these old dirt roads
Where the cotton fields and memories grow
Passed the church where grandma prayed
And the creek where we used to wade

[Verse 2]
Daddy's truck is rusting now
But I still remember how
He taught me everything I know
About working hard and letting go

[Chorus]
These roots run deep beneath my feet
Through every joy and every defeat
No matter where this life may lead
I'll always know where I come from
These roots run deep

[Verse 3]
Mama's kitchen smells the same
Biscuits rising, her love unchanged
Sunday dinners, family ties
The simple things money can't buy

[Chorus]
These roots run deep beneath my feet
Through every joy and every defeat
No matter where this life may lead
I'll always know where I come from
These roots run deep

[Bridge]
City lights may call my name
But this red clay runs through my veins

[Outro Chorus]
These roots run deep beneath my feet
I'll always know where I come from
These roots run deep
